title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the top of the paper.

extractions.description: This paper introduces LAROUSSE, a new framework to detect textual adversarial attacks, and STAKEOUT, a new benchmark consisting of nine attack methods, three datasets, and two pre-trained models. It aims to enhance the detection of textual adversarial attacks in NLP systems.

type.justification: The paper involves the empirical evaluation of the proposed methods (LAROUSSE and STAKEOUT) using numerical experiments and benchmark comparisons.
type.quote: We conduct extensive numerical experiments which demonstrate that LAROUSSE outperforms previous methods, and which allows to identify interesting factors of detection rate variations.

name.value: Adversarial Attacks in Natural Language Processing
name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on detecting adversarial attacks in natural language processing models.
name.quote: The landscape of available textual adversarial attacks keeps growing, posing severe threats and raising concerns regarding the deep NLP systemâ€™s integrity.

name.justification: The paper specifically aims at detecting adversarial attacks on text data in NLP systems.
name.quote: This paper makes two important contributions in this line of search: (i) we introduce LAROUSSE, a new framework to detect textual adversarial attacks.

name.justification: The paper introduces a new benchmark STAKEOUT for evaluating adversarial attack detection methods in NLP.
name.quote: we introduce STAKEOUT, a new benchmark composed of nine popular attack methods, three datasets, and two pre-trained models.

name.justification: LAROUSSE is the main model introduced in the paper for detecting textual adversarial attacks.
name.quote: we introduce LAROUSSE, a new framework to detect textual adversarial attacks.

aliases: textuaL AdversaRial detectOr Using halfSpace maSs dEpth

is_contributed.justification: LAROUSSE is a direct contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we introduce LAROUSSE, a new framework to detect textual adversarial attacks.

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions that numerical experiments were conducted using LAROUSSE, which implies it was executed.
is_executed.quote: we conduct extensive numerical experiments which demonstrate that LAROUSSE outperforms previous methods.

is_compared.justification: LAROUSSE is compared with other methods in terms of performance in the experimental section.
is_compared.quote: we conduct extensive numerical experiments which demonstrate that LAROUSSE outperforms previous methods.

referenced_paper_title.justification: LAROUSSE is presented as a new framework in this paper; it does not have a reference paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: we introduce LAROUSSE, a new framework to detect textual adversarial attacks.

name.justification: BERT is one of the pre-trained models used in the benchmark experiments in the paper.
name.quote: We work with classifiers that are based on two types of pre-trained encoders: BERT and ROBERTA.

is_contributed.justification: BERT is not a contribution of this paper, but it is used for the evaluations.

referenced_paper_title.value: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for BERT is 'BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In order to ensure that our conclusions are not model specific, we work with classifiers that are based on two types of pre-trained encoders: BERT [Devlin et al., 2019] and ROBERTA (ROB) [Liu et al., 2019].

name.justification: ROBERTA is one of the pre-trained models used in the benchmark experiments in the paper.
name.quote: We work with classifiers that are based on two types of pre-trained encoders: BERT and ROBERTA.

referenced_paper_title.value: RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for ROBERTA is 'RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In order to ensure that our conclusions are not model specific, we work with classifiers that are based on two types of pre-trained encoders: BERT [Devlin et al., 2019] and ROBERTA (ROB) [Liu et al., 2019].

name.justification: SST2 is one of the datasets used for the benchmark in this paper.
name.quote: We choose to work on sentiment analysis, using SST2 [Socher et al., 2013] and IMDB [Maas et al., 2011], and topic classification, relying on ag-news [Joachims, 1996].
